title: Public transport for the NBL Round 18 – Melbourne United v S.E. Melbourne Phoenix: Saturday 3 February 2024
articleContent:
Public transport for the NBL Round 18 – Melbourne United v S.E. Melbourne Phoenix: Saturday 3 February 2024

Public transport is your best way to enjoy NBL as the Melbourne United take on S.E. Melbourne Phoenix. Extra services will help you get to and from John Cain Arena on Saturday 3 February

The event will begin at 8pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

  • Normal services operating from Richmond Station

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from John Cain Arena

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street/Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following buses close to John Cain Arena:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Normal services depart from Southern Cross Station.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.
articleDescription: Round 14 – NBL Round 18 – Melbourne Utd v S.E. Melb Phoenix: Saturday 3 February 2024
